cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.csv

Class SearchEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.csv.SearchEngine

  • public class SearchEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides public static methods for querying the ProductAPI for Content items. Delegates the actual search logic to the IProductAPI. For executing Content searches by passing in a CSV with search criteria, the query file must be in the following column format:
    1. list of content categories (pipe-separated)
    2. search text (will scan Content name, description, author name)
    3. minimum content rating (from 0 to 5, where 5 is best)
    4. maximum price (as a float, in BitCoins)
    5. list of supported language codes (pipe-separated)
    6. list of country codes (pipe-separated)
    7. device ID
    8. list of content types (can be any or all of "application", "ringtone", or "wallpaper" currently)
    For example, here is a sample of what a valid content item query CSV file might look like: 
     # catgory_list, text_search, minimum_rating, max_price, language_list, country_code, device_id, content_type_list
 # search for "Ferrari" in name or description
  , Ferrari, , , , , ,
 # search for all content with a minimum rating of 4 and a price of 0 or less (i.e. free)
  , , 4, 0, , , ,
 ...
    Content items found are printed to standard out.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Killeffer <rayden7@gmail.com>
    See Also:
    IProductAPI, ProductAPI, Content, Importer, Application, Ringtone, Wallpaper

    • Method Detail

      • getContentSearchForCSV

        public static ContentSearch getContentSearchForCSV(java.lang.String queryLine)
                                            throws ParseException
        Given a string line with content search criteria from the original query CSV file, parse the contents of the search query and create and return a new ContentSearch object that can be passed to IProductAPI to execute the actual query OR can be used in DynamicCollections as the content item search criteria.
        Parameters:
        queryLine - the original line from the search CSV to search for matching content (should be in this format: ", , , , , , , ")
        Throws:
        ParseException - if there is an issue parsing out the search content query criteria from queryLine

      • executeQuery

        public static void executeQuery(java.lang.String queryLine)
                         throws ParseException
        Given a string line from the original query CSV file, parse out the contents of the search query and create a new ContentSearch object that can be passed to IProductAPI to execute the actual query and find matching content items. Found matching content items are printed to standard out.
        Parameters:
        queryLine - the original line from the search CSV to search for matching content
        Throws:
        ParseException - if there is an issue parsing out the search content query criteria from queryLine

      • executeQueryFilename

        public static void executeQueryFilename(java.lang.String filename)
                                 throws QueryEngineException,
                                        ImportException,
                                        ParseException
        Public method for executing search queries against the ProductAPI for Content items. Content may be searched for using any of the following properties of Content items:
        1. list of content categories (pipe-separated)
        2. search text (will scan Content name, description, author name)
        3. minimum content rating (from 0 to 5, where 5 is best)
        4. maximum price (as a float, in BitCoins)
        5. list of supported language codes (pipe-separated)
        6. list of country codes (pipe-separated)
        7. device ID
        8. list of content types (can be any or all of "application", "ringtone", or "wallpaper" currently)
        Checks for valid input file name. Delegates to executeQuery(String) for processing individual search queries. Throws ImportException on error accessing or processing the input search query file.
        Parameters:
        filename - file with CSV search criteria for Content items in the product catalog
        Throws:
        ImportException - thrown when encountering non-parse related exceptions in the file import process
        ParseException - thrown when encountering any issues parsing the input file related to the format of the file contents
        QueryEngineException
